results.title: Hands in Harmony
results.creator_credit: Douglas Tunstell, Sydney Newman and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: One of a series of films featuring Canadian musical talent. Saskatchewan’s Neil Chotem, composer, conductor and concert pianist, plays Chopin’s Black Key Study and Study in E Major.

results.title: Handmaidens and battleaxes
results.brief_description: This is an informative and entertaining documentary which traces the role of nurses from pre-industrial times to the modern day. The program uses rare archival footage, dramatic re-enactments, personal interviews and photographic stills collected from nursing colleges from three continents. These elements successfully combine to give insight into the reality of the nursing profession.

results.title: Handling the catch
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop
results.brief_description: For five days and nights a trawler steams up the east coast of Britain to reach the northern fishing grounds of the Atlantic. The object of this routine voyage is to spend two weeks catching, preserving and landing some twelve thousand pounds worth of high quality white fish. The importance of cleanliness, care and cooling is stressed in order to preserve a profitable catch.

results.title: Handling marital conflicts
results.creator_credit: Paul Landis, Centron and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
Through the development of an argument between each of two couples, elements of destructive and constructive marital conflicts are illustrated. The audience is encouraged to distinguish between the two, and in conclusion five comparative points are made.

results.title: Handling loose materials
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, Marcus Cooper and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: The handling of granular or powdered materials in the loose state. The first part describes some mechanical techniques, including conventional closed circuit conveyor; bucket elevator; “zipper” conveyor; self-discharging barge handling grain with a combination of equipment. The second part describes some pneumatic techniques, including principles of pressurised transfer and fluidisation etc.

results.title: Handling Home Work
results.brief_description: Homework is one of the major problems for families with teenage children. This video addresses those problems and offers real solutions for both parents and students. Presented by John Cheetham.

results.title: Handling complaints
results.brief_description: Dealing with customer complaints is a part of business. Whether by phone or in person a customer’s complaints can tell you about product and service problems within your company. This instructional video provides tangible resolutions to better client service when dealing with complaints whether by phone or in person. Emphasised here are listening skills, showing respect and finding a solution for your client. This video contains a number of case studies that emphasise best client practice whilst illustrating problematic service styles.

results.title: Handling angry customers over the phone
results.brief_description: Angry customers may be found in any business. This instructive video portrays three business settings; telemarketing, the computer industry and an accounts department; all feature an angry customer over the phone. The scenarios depict a variety of conflicting reactions such as aggression and passivity. As a response to the scenarios the video provides key concepts such as; rational rather than emotional responses, positive rather than negative phrases, assertive as opposed to passive, active listening skills and the importance of a supportive work environment.

results.title: Handling and preserving family records
results.creator_credit: Rodney Crouch, James S. Cable and Cable Crouch Productions
results.brief_description: Presented by a range of conservation experts from the British Public Records office, this program looks at the handling and storage of family documents, books, textiles, photographs, films, recorded tapes and military memorabilia, to avoid deterioration. The use of acid free containers, correct temperature control and ventilation, transport methods as well as information about materials and cleaning practices likely to damage family heirlooms are shown.

results.title: Handling and care of the patient
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Intended for the instruction of nurses and porters as well as medical students, this film deals with the general care of the patient before, during, and after anaesthesia.
